intro: Rourea sprucei var. rondoniensis, commonly known as the Rondoniense Rourea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
